snippet: A few states raised their minimum wages on New Year’s Day. At a time of increasing inequality, the federal minimum needs a boost, too.
abstract: Editorial commends several states for voluntarily raising their minimum wage, but asserts that a federal increase is long past due; notes real value of federal minimum wage has declined by over 25 percent since its peak in 1968; contends that for minimum wage to combat income inequality, it must apply to a large section of the labor force, and that goal would be better met if federal government set the standard.
lead_paragraph: A few states raised their minimum wages on New Year’s Day. At a time of increasing inequality, the federal minimum needs a boost, too.
